title: GMOA doctors resume strike in Eastern Province
byline: The Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) announced that the strike launched by doctors in all government hospitals across the Eastern Province will resume from 8.00 a.m. today (19), as the government has failed to respond to their demands.

title: Mainly dry weather expected in most parts of the island
byline: Mainly dry weather will prevail in the most parts of the island, today (19), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Two high-speed trains derail in Spain, police sources say 21 people killed
byline: A high-speed train derailed and smashed into another oncoming train in southern Spain on Sunday, pushing the second train off the tracks and down an embankment in a collision that police sources confirmed to Reuters had killed at least 21 people.

title: Over 1,000 imported salt containers stranded at Colombo Port for six months
byline: It has been revealed that more than 1,000 containers of salt imported into the country have been held at the Colombo Port warehouses for over six months after the expiry of the approved import period.

title: 19-year old arrested for aiding and abetting Kaduwela shooting incident
byline: Another individual who had allegedly aided and abetted the shooting incident that occurred on January 01, 2026 in Menikagara Road, Koratota, Nawagamuwa, in the Kaduwela area, has been arrested.

title: Chile fires kill at least 18 as firefighters battle extreme heat, winds
byline: Chilean President Gabriel Boric declared a state of catastrophe in two regions in the south of the country on Sunday as raging wildfires forced at least 20,000 people to evacuate and left at least 18 people dead.

title: Foreign-made pistol found in abandoned water tank in Keselwatta
byline: A foreign-manufactured pistol has been discovered from an abandoned water tank within an apartment complex in the Keselwatta area.

title: Govt commits to global best practices for child and caregiver well-being: Minister
byline: The Minister of Women and Child Affairs, Saroja Savithri Paulraj, stated that the government has undertaken numerous initiatives to strengthen Early Childhood Development (ECD) and care.

title: PM Harini departs for World Economic Forum 2026 in Davos
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya departed Sri Lanka earlier this morning (19) to participate in the 56th Annual Meeting of the World Economic Forum (WEF) in Davos-Klosters, Switzerland, the PM’s Office said.

title: Decline in air quality observed across several areas; CEA advises caution
byline: The Media Spokesperson for the Central Environmental Authority (CEA), Dr. Ajith Gunawardena says that a decline in air quality has been reported in multiple parts of the country.

title: Death toll in Karachi mall fire jumps to 11
byline: Firefighters in Karachi began searching on Monday for more than 60 missing people after a massive fire destroyed a shopping mall in Pakistan’s most populous city, while the death toll from the disaster rose to 11.

title: Parents stage silent protest near Edu. Ministry demanding Grade 6 reforms
byline: A group of parents has launched a continuous silent protest this morning (19) in front of the Ministry of Education, urging the immediate implementation of the recently suspended proposed education reforms for Grade 6 students.

title: Tripadvisor Travelers’ Choice Awards 2026: Colombo among best food cities; Galle in top 5 honeymoon destinations
byline: Sri Lanka has received significant international recognition in the “Tripadvisor Travelers’ Choice Awards – Best of the Best 2026”, with Colombo and Galle being named among the world’s top destinations under two categories, marking a major boost for the country’s tourism and hospitality industries.

title: ‘Send Your Name to the Moon’: NASA opens public participation for Artemis II mission
byline: NASA Artemis II: As part of one of its historic missions, NASA has invited people from around the world to become part of its Artemis II mission by sending their names to space.

title: Baladaksha Mawatha flyover declared open
byline: The Baladaksha Mawatha flyover was declared open to the public today (19).

title: Parliamentary Sub-Committee reviews execution of principal transfers in national and provincial schools
byline: The implementation of transfers of Principals in National and Provincial Schools and related matters, together with the existing human resource shortages in schools, has been discussed recently at the meeting of the Parliamentary Sub-Committee.

title: President to chair special discussion on exposition of sacred Buddha relics from India
byline: A special discussion regarding the exposition of the Sacred Relics of Buddha, which will be brought down from India, will be held on January 21, under the patronage of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, according to Minister of Health and Mass Media Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa.

title: Factory explosion in China kills two, injures 84
byline: A huge explosion at a factory in northern China has killed two people and injured 84 others, with eight people still missing, state media reported.

title: Public to be notified on ‘Rebuilding Sri Lanka Fund’ donations through its website
byline: The official website related to the “Rebuilding Sri Lanka” national programme has been launched under the patronage of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.

title: China’s population falls for fourth straight year
byline: China’s population fell for the fourth straight year in 2025 as its birth rates sunk to a record low, despite the government rolling out a spate of incentives to boost them.

title: Grama Niladhari officers withdraw from disbursement of Rs. 5 million cyclone relief grant
byline: The Grama Niladhari Trade Union Alliance has decided to withdraw from the process of disbursing the Rs. 5 million government grant allocated for residential properties that were partially damaged as a result of cyclone Ditwah.

title: Railway station masters threaten to launch trade union action over several demands
byline: The Sri Lanka Railway Station Masters’ Union has threatened to launch a trade union action citing several unresolved demands.

title: Japan PM Takaichi to dissolve parliament Friday and call national election
byline: Japan’s Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi said she will dissolve parliament Friday and call a national election to seek voter backing for increased spending and a new security strategy expected to accelerate Japan’s defence build up.

title: Three arrested over circulation of video abusing woman on social media
byline: An individual has been arrested by the Bureau for the Prevention of Abuse of Children and Women in connection with a video circulating on social media depicting a woman being abused.

title: Govt keen to promote cashless economy and introduce digital IDs
byline: Extensive discussions have been held at a review meeting at the Presidential Secretariat pertaining to the progress of projects planned by the government to promote a cashless economy in Sri Lanka, including the digitalisation of government institutions, promotion of QR transactions and the completion of the digital identity card project.

title: NGJA revises taxation method for imported rough gemstones to support industry
byline: The National Gem and Jewellery Authority (NGJA) has announced a revision to the taxation methodology for importing rough gemstones, aiming to provide relief to industry stakeholders and support the country’s goal of achieving $1 billion in annual gem export earnings.

title: Special traffic plan in Colombo in view of Sri Lanka-England cricket series
byline: A special traffic plan will be in place in Colombo during the upcoming Sri Lanka-England cricket matches to be played at the R. Premadasa International Cricket Stadium.

title: Trump justifies threats to take over Greenland, citing Nobel Peace Prize snub
byline: US President Donald Trump told Norway’s prime minister he no longer needed to think “purely of peace” after failing to win the Nobel Peace Prize, in a message published Monday.

title: Search operation launched to locate two missing fishermen
byline: Two individuals, who set out for fishing in a boat early this morning (19) from Wella, Chilaw have been reported missing, police stated.

title: Tourist arrivals in 2026 top 150,000
byline: A total of 158,787 tourists have arrived in the country thus far in 2026, data from the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA) shows.

title: GMOA announces island-wide trade union action from Friday
byline: A decision has been taken to launch a continuous island-wide trade union action starting January 23, the Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) has announced.

title: Donald Trump sets US$ 1 billion price tag for Board of Peace membership
byline: A draft charter of the Gaza “Board of Peace,” sent to about 60 countries by the Trump administration in the United States, reportedly calls for members to contribute US$ 1 billion in cash if they want their membership to last more than three years.

title: Trinco Buddha Statue Incident: Ven. Balangoda Kassapa Thero and others further remanded
byline: Four Buddhist monks, including Ven. Balangoda Kassapa Thero, and six other individuals who were arrested and subsequently remanded for allegedly violating coastal conservation laws by placing a Buddha statue at the Trincomalee Bodhiraja Viharaya have been further remanded.

title: SLTB bus driver sentenced to rigorous imprisonment over fatal accident
byline: A Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) bus driver attached to the Kebithigollewa Depot has been sentenced to one year of rigorous imprisonment after being found guilty of causing the death of a person.

title: Iran to consider lifting internet ban; state TV hacked
byline: Iran may lift its internet blackout in a few days, a senior parliament member said on Monday, after authorities shut communications while they used massive force to crush protests in the worst domestic unrest since the 1979 Islamic Revolution.

title: India’s central bank proposes linking BRICS’ digital currencies
byline: India’s central bank has proposed that BRICS countries link their official digital currencies to make cross-border trade and tourism payments easier, two sources said, which could reduce reliance on the U.S. dollar as geopolitical tensions rise.

title: Colombo HC records witness evidence in case against Mervyn Silva
byline: The case filed by the Bribery Commission against former Minister Mervyn Silva, over allegations that he acquired assets in excess of his lawful income during his tenure as a minister, was taken up again before the Colombo High Court today.

title: Highest temperature recorded in Ratnapura, lowest from Nuwara Eliya
byline: The highest temperature in the country today (19) was recorded from the Ratnapura Meteorological Station at 32.9°C, the Department of Meteorology noted.

title: Transport Minister promises corruption-free development
byline: The present administration aims to advance the country’s development without theft or corruption, the Minister of Transport, Highways and Urban Development, Bimal Rathnayaka stated.

title: NIE Deputy Director General sent on compulsory leave
byline: The Deputy Director General of the National Institute of Education (NIE), Darshana Samaraweera has been sent on compulsory leave in relation to the controversial Grade 6 English module.

title: Notice issued on Cinnamon Gardens Police minor complaints OIC
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court has issued a notice ordering the Officer-in-Charge of the Minor Complaints Division of the Cinnamon Gardens Police, who conducted investigations into a case filed against former Minister Wimal Weerawansa and six other accused, to appear before court.

title: Supreme Court allows withdrawal of Manusha Nanayakkara’s FR petition
byline: Former Minister Manusha Nanayakkara has withdrawn the Fundamental Rights petition he filed before the Supreme Court seeking an order to prevent his arrest by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) in connection with the South Korean visa issue.

title: IMF raises India’s GDP growth projection
byline: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) on Monday revised its estimate of India’s gross domestic product (GDP) growth in the current financial year (April 2025-March 2026) upward to 7.3 percent, from its earlier prediction of 6.6 percent.
